child.name: npcode
child.description: <p>The Numbering plan the of the directory number.</p><p>This parameter will give information about the type of the searched directory numbers.</p><p>The type is visible also in client from the <code>NumberingPlans.NP_CLASS</code> output parameter of the <code>NUMBERING_PLANS.SEARCH</code> command.</p><p>For a particular service, the command <code>SERVICES.READ</code> returns the required Numbering Plan for directory numbers.</p>
child.label: npcode

child.name: npcodePub
child.description: <p>Public key of the numbering plan.</p>
child.label: npcodePub

child.name: plcode
child.description: <p>Network the searched resources should belong to.</p>
child.label: plcode

child.name: plcodePub
child.description: <p>Public key of the network</p>
child.label: plcodePub

child.name: dirnum
child.label: dirnum

child.name: externalState
child.description: <p>Dependent on PC:15293 license</p><p>Directory number resources with EXTERNAL_STATE different from NULL must not be assignable to contracts, at CX. Those resources are used and managed by external systems.</p><p>EXTERNAL_STATE is not restricted into a domain. Operator can set it to any character value.</p>
child.label: externalState

child.label: csId
